Dear Jason Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A had destroyed a room which caused a small laceration to
the right side of his hand on his middle finger and a small abrasion
to his right shin. This was not caused by self-harm but due to an
emotional outburst. Youth A was hanging out with some friends in
a room, which they were cleared to do. "Dreads" kept turning the
light on and Youth A and friends would turn it off. The youth
asked him to stop. "Dreads" said he was just making sure they
were not doing anything. He then called them "queer boys" and
"homos." This got Youth A riled up and at some point "Dreads"
called Youth A a pedophile. "Dreads" then went around telling
everyone that Youth A was a pedophile and they should be careful
around him. That riled Youth A up more and led to him destroying
the room.
Investigation Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/15/2025. He reported being informed of the incident and Youth
A being taken to the hospital but returning the next day. He also
reported having an incident report which indicated the youth in the
hallway were talking about having sex while cursing and yelling at
staff. He reported Youth A attacked Staff 2 and struck Staff 2 with
Staff 2’s keys after taking the keys from Staff 2. He also reported
the three youth (Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C) were refusing to
go into their bedrooms for bedtime and had brought their
mattresses and blankets into the hallway. He reported no prior
concerns about Staff 1’s performance.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/15/2025. Youth A reported the incident was “no big deal
because I’m going to independent living today”. Youth A also
reported knowing that Youth A was supposed to be in the
bedroom and not in the hallway. Youth A reported Youth B and
2

Youth C were having a sleep over in the hallway and Youth A
joined them. Youth A also reported Staff 1 was calling Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C names like “faggots, butt buddies” and
called Youth A, a “pedophile”. Youth A reported continuing to go
“back and forth” with Staff 1 but being bothered by the pedophile
comment. Youth A reported going into the milieu and wanting to
fight Staff 1 because of the comment. Youth A reported getting
into Staff 1’s face and having Staff 1 say he was sorry if the
comment offended Youth A, but Youth A continued to be bothered
by the word pedophile. Youth A also reported Staff 1 went into the
office and Staff 3 tried to “calm me down”. Youth A reported not
wanting anything to do with Staff 3, so Youth A began to throw
chairs because Youth A wanted to hurt Staff 1 for the pedophile
comment. Youth A also reported trying to break the office window
so Youth A could get to Staff 1. Youth A reported in the past joking
with Staff 1 and having Staff 1 call Youth A “gay” but never calling
Youth A, a pedophile. Youth A also reported Youth A’s knuckle
was bleeding but that Youth A “didn’t get hurt” when he put his
hand and arm through the window in the office.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/15/2025. Youth B reported being in the hallway at the time of the
incident and stated Staff 1 and Youth A were joking around. Youth
B also reported “they (Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Staff 1)
were joking about being gay or something like that” Youth B
reported Staff 1 said something and Youth A took offense and
became angry. Youth A asked Staff 1 to stop joking and Staff 1
stopped, and Youth B believed Youth A should not have become
upset. Youth B reported avoiding Youth A after Youth A became
upset at staff. Youth B reported Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
were turning off the lights as a joke as Staff 1 turned the lights on.
Youth B reported Staff 1 would joke with Youth A in the past and
both Youth A and Staff 1 would just stop if someone got offended.
Youth B reported not liking it when Youth A begins to break things
and now that Youth A is gone, Youth B feels safe in the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/15/2025. Youth C reported remembering the incident which took
place in the hallway while Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C were
having a “sleep over”. Youth C reported Staff 1 told Youth A
“you’re hanging around a 15-year-old for a sleep over and that’s
kind of gay”. Youth C reported Youth A responded with “you’re
calling me a pedophile” and then wanted to fight Staff 1. Youth C
reported Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Staff 1 were all joking in
the beginning before Youth A became upset. They were turning
off the light every time Staff 1 turned on the lights as another form
3

of joking. Youth C reported being in the hallway when Youth A
was breaking things in the milieu area. Youth C reported in the
past Youth A and Staff 1 would joke with Staff 1 making gay jokes,
but this time Youth A was not in a joking mood. Youth C reported
feeling safe at the facility and that the program is really helping
Youth C change.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/15/2025. He reported working the unit at the time of the incident.
He reported the incident began with the youth (Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth C) in the hallway, refusing to go to their rooms and
placing their mattresses in the hallway. He reported Staff 1 was
joking with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C about them needing to
go back into their rooms. He reported Youth A came out of the
hallway and into the milieu where Youth A picked up a chair and
threw it across the room. Youth A then threw another chair before
going back into the hallway. Staff 3 reported Youth A said that
“someone call him a pedophile and Staff 3 stated never hearing
that statement. Staff 3 reported overhearing Youth A confront Staff
1 and Staff 1 apologizing and stating Staff 1 never called Youth A
a pedophile. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 stated “sorry I said anything
that offended you, but I didn’t call you that”. Staff 3 reported
hearing Staff 1, Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C laughing in the
hallway but was unable to recall what they were joking about. Staff
3 reported being shocked that Youth A came into the milieu and
began throwing chairs because 2-5 minutes earlier was when
Staff 1, Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C were in the hallway
laughing. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 would joke with the youth in the
past but never overhearing any gay jokes. Staff 3 reported hearing
different youth make gay jokes but not any of the staff. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 seems to be a favorite staff for the youth in the
program. Staff 3 reported going into the office behind a locked
door when Youth A was throwing chairs and breaking the office
window before calling Law Enforcement because that is the action
staff are to take.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/19/2025. Staff 2 reported working on the unit the time of the
allegations and witnessed Youth A coming out of the hallway 20
minutes after Staff 1 left the hallway. Once in the milieu where
Staff 2 was located, Youth A began to throw chairs and “tear up”
chairs. Staff 2 reported not remembering the interaction between
Staff 1 and Youth A but did hear Youth A say, “you think I am a
pedophile” or something like “you called me a pedophile”. Staff 2
reported Youth A was very angry and Staff 1 stated something like
“I didn’t call you a pedophile, if you think I did I apologize”. Staff 2
4

believes this was Staff 1’s attempt to de-escalate Youth A and that
Staff 1 did a good job of trying to de-escalate Youth A. Staff 2
reported Youth A then attempted to pick up a table to which Staff
2 became involved and kept Youth A from picking up the table by
holding the table down, At that time, Youth A grabbed Staff 2’s
keys and struck Staff 2 a couple of times with Staff 2’s keys. Staff
2 reported being told by Supervisor to remove himself from the
milieu and Staff 2 went into the office and shut the door behind
himself. Staff 2 reported Youth A became calm when Law
Enforcement came to the unit and removed Youth A to the
hospital. Staff 2 reported observing Youth A and Staff 1 interact
the next day after Youth A came back from the hospital. The
interaction was positive, and Youth A acted like nothing had
occurred. Staff 2 reported normally Staff 1 is joking with the
different youth on the program and the joking helps to calm the
different youth down. Staff 2 reported they joke about normal
things and not gay issues and Staff 2 sees this interaction as just
playful.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/19/2025. He reported working on the unit at the time of the
incident and witnessing Youth A come out of the south hallway,
picking up a chair and throwing the chair in the milieu. He
witnessed Staff 2 ask Staff 1 what the problem and Staff 1 was
responded with “I don’t know”. When Staff 1 came out of the
hallway and walked past Youth A in the milieu, Youth A began
yelling and saying, “call me a pedophile again and I will beat your
ass”. Supervisor heard Staff 1 respond, “I don’t know what I said
but I didn’t say that to you, and I apologize to you”. He reported
Youth A attempted to grab a table, but Staff 2 stopped Youth A by
grabbing and holding the table to the floor. Then Youth A grabbed
the keys from Staff 2 and began to hit Staff 2 with Staff 2’s keys.
Supervisor reported being in the office calling administration to
inform them of the situation. He reported Youth A then came to
the office window and tapped the window with a broken chair
wooden piece. Then Youth A broke the window by hitting the
window with the broken chair wooden piece. Supervisor reported
staff in the office went out the back door to monitor the youth from
a different vantage point. Law Enforcement came to the facility
and Supervisor let them into the milieu. Youth A had calmed down
and was taken to the hospital by Law Enforcement. Supervisor
was asked about joking between staff and youth and reported
Staff 1 will joke with all of the youth. He also reported any gray
area jokes come from the youth not the staff and he has never
heard staff make inappropriate jokes in front of the youth. He
reported staff are to shut down the youth if they are making
5

inappropriate jokes. He reported staff can joke (nothing sexual or
racial) but not swear when speaking to the youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/19/2025. Staff 1 reported being aware of the reasons for this
interview. He reported Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C were
refusing to go into their bedrooms and go to sleep. These three
youth (Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C) were in the hallway and
Staff 1 was trying to figure out what was happening with these
youth. He reported Youth A was being disrespectful when Youth A
said “all staff can suck penis” but Staff 1 thought, Youth A was just
joking. Staff 1 also reported responding to Youth A by saying, “it’s
funny calling staff dick suckers by your laying on a bed with two
others looking like butt buddies”. Staff 1 reported not knowing that
would upset Youth A and didn’t say anything after that statement.
Staff 1 reported telling the youth (Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C)
that if they wanted to sleep in the hallway that was ok with Staff 1,
just before leaving the hallway to get medication for another youth
in the program. Staff 1 reported when coming out of the
medication room and into the milieu, he observed Youth A
throwing chairs in the milieu and didn’t know what Youth A was
upset about. Staff 1 reported walking past Youth A and going to
tell Youth B and Youth C to go to their bedrooms down the
hallway. As Staff 1 was walking past Youth A, Youth A stated, “call
me a pedophile again” and Staff 1 told Youth A, that Staff 1 never
said that. Staff 1 reported trying to speak to Youth A and
approached Youth A with Staff 1’s hands open. Staff 1 reported
apologizing to Youth A and making it clear that Staff 1 did not call
Youth A a pedophile. Staff 1 reported noticing Youth A becoming
more dysregulated and Staff 1 felt defensive. Youth A began to
throw chairs, so Staff 1 went to the office. Once in the office Staff
1 reported Youth A took a piece of a broken chair and broke the
office window before putting Youth A’s arm through the broken
glass. Once Law Enforcement was contacted and arrived, Youth A
calmed down. Staff 1 reported a good relationship with Youth A
and that they would joke about things they (Staff 1 and Youth A)
found funny. Staff 1 also reported Youth A has called other staff
gay and laughed and was unable to recall any grey areas of joking
that he has engaged in. Staff 1 believes joking help build repour
with the youth in the program now understands that he needs to
stay with the appropriate boundaries. He reported some jokes
could trigger youth and cause them harm and, in the future, will
not joke like he did anymore.
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 6/5/2025. He
reported having no additional information to provide and did not
6

witness any of the incident. He reported only making the complaint
based on information from Youth A. He reported the injuries on
Youth A’s hand appeared to be the result of Youth A placing
Youth A’s hand through the window in the office.
Documents Reviewed:
Email was received from Foster Care Worker on 5/13/25 in
response to email sent informing about investigation. Foster
Care Worker had no questions or information to add.
Wedgewood Christian Services Significant Event Report
dated 5/12/25 at 9:00 pm. This report is documented as being
completed by Supervisor and involves Youth A, Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Supervisor. It is documented that this event area is classified
as client related and the event type is documented as
ambulance/hospitalization, assault, Police contact, and property
damage. The narrative documents that Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C were refusing bedtime and not following staff’s directions.
These three youth are documented as becoming loud and making
comments to staff about how they (Youth A, Youth B, and Youth
C) were going to have sex. Staff are documented as trying to
verbally de-escalate and encourage the three youth to go to their
bedrooms. Youth A is documented as claiming staff called Youth
A a pedophile and having the staff try to reason with Youth A and
de-escalate the situation. Youth A is documented as continuing to
call staff “bitches and pussies”. Youth A is then documented as
approaching staff and threatening to hurt staff. Youth A took Staff
2’s keys and struck Staff 2 with the keys. It is documented Youth
A engaged in property destruction on the unit by breaking chairs,
tables, and shattering the staff office window with a piece of wood
from a chair. It is also documented staff followed the appropriate
safety plan by egressing to the staff office. Law Enforcement was
called and upon arriving took Youth A into custody and then the
hospital. This document indicates Youth A was offered medical
attention by staff but denied needing any care. Administrator
signed off on this document.
Wedgwood Christian Services Procedure: Suitable Treatment
and Freedom of Movement Procedures (02-08) dated
6/20/2024. This document outlines that youth are entitled to
several issues with their treatment such as treatment with dignity
and respect. Dignity and respect are outlined as staff are not to
demean a youth with examples of talking down to or ridiculing,
teasing, mocking, or taunting a youth, obscene language or
gestures towards or around youth, and talking about sexual acts.
7

Wedgwood Christian Services Procedure: Behavior
Management Procedures (03-16) dated 7/3/2024. This
document outlines that when clinically advisable staff should
employ supportive behavior management including a variety of
verbal de-escalation approaches. This should be done prior to any
form of physical management. It is documented that the building
of healthy and therapeutic relationships will generally lead youth to
personal growth and increased self-control.
Wedgwood Christian Services Temporary Safety Plan for
Staff 1 dated 5/14/24. It is documented that this safety plan was
put into place because of Staff 1’s alleged actions resulting in the
need for this safety plan. The action steps involve the following.
Staff 1 will not be alone with Youth A in any space on or off
campus and Staff 1 will not complete safety checks or bed checks
in the south hallway.
HR file for Staff 1 was reviewed. Documentation indicates Staff
1 was hired on 5/24/23. Documentation in the file indicates a
progressive chain of disciplinary action for tardiness with a written
warning on 4/17/24 and disciplinary action noticed on 7/17/24. It is
documented Staff 1 completed the probationary period on 5/15/25.
Documentation also indicates Staff 1 is current on training.
Video Review:
The view from the camera is of the south hallway where the
bedrooms for Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C are located. At the
beginning of the video recording, Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
are all sitting outside of their bedroom doors in the hallway. Youth
C goes to his room and brings a mattress out and Youth A then
brings his mattress out of the bedroom and into the hallway.
Occasionally, the lights turn off but then one of the youths turn the
lights back on by using the switch at their end of the hall. All three-
youth leave the hallway for a few minutes going into the milieu
before returning. Staff 1 is observed entering the hallway and
turning the light back on to which one of the youths turn the lights
back off. At approximately 8:55 pm Youth A is observed speaking
to Staff 1 before Youth A takes the staff chair at the end of the
hallway and places it in front of the bathroom. Youth A then takes
the chair and places it in the milieu. At approximately 9:04 pm in
the milieu Staff 1 is speaking with Youth A and Staff 3 is present.
This is the view from the camera in the milieu area. Staff 2 is also
present in the milieu area at this time. Staff 1 leaves the area after
about a minute and enters the staff office. Youth A picks up a
8

heavy wooden chair and throws the chair before approaching Staff
2 and grabbing Staff 2’s keys. Youth A then hits Staff 2 with the
keys before grabbing another heavy wooden chair and throwing
the chair. Staff 2 stays away but provides direct supervision of
Youth A. At 9:16 pm Youth hits and breaks the office window with
a part of a broken wooden chair. Youth A then reaches through
the window causing a cut on his hand. Youth A then hits the
window with another heavy wooden chair causing the chair to
become stuck in the window. At 9:22 Law Enforcement arrives,
and Youth A appears to calm down.
Walk-through:
A walk-through was completed at the facility. The facility is a
single-story building in good repair. The facility is furnished
appropriately, especially in the bedroom areas.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as evidenced by interviews
with staff, youth, documents, and video reviews. Evidence
indicates Staff 1 used inappropriate language when address
Youth A which appears to have triggered Youth A’s trauma
response. Evidence also supports this occurred because Staff 1
admitted to making the negative statement to Youth A.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered regarding different staff
interviewed admitting to staff joking with youth. It is recommended
that all staff understand that joking if not aware of the youth’s
trauma history could lead to similar results. Staff should also be
reminded of their primary role of being agents of healing for the
youth.
Conclusion Violation Established
9

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
